To the glory of God the Father. You know what Zacchaeus is doing here? He's recognizing that Jesus is Lord. He's recognizing that He is the Messiah. That He is God in flesh. We mention this when we study and read about the passage of Scripture with the conversion of Saul and Saul says, who art thou Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest. It is hard for thee to kick against the pricks. And then Saul at this time, he responds and he says, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And here Zacchaeus in Luke 19 and verse 8, he said, behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor, and if I have taken anything from any man by false accusation, I restore him fourfold. I want you to understand that in verse 8, the actions that Zacchaeus takes, the things that he says he's going to do, that's not what brought him salvation. That's the result of his salvation.
